> [kapec](#comment_15_1CQ14MAUEp55ijU6rQLQ9vZdzxCQe9s1SF): But don't you think P2P networks are inherently socialistic? There is no one person or company that can claim possession over the data inside, we're all owning it and redistributing it as a collective.

You pushed all my red political buttons but I don't have an argument against what you said.  :-)

1613761105_1PZivKEBF8sdpTRbeb9Wug8HMv3Cf.body:
Yes. :-)

Crypto can both store 'value' and quickly transport value.  Crypto by its nature also self-assays.   Crypto enables transport of value between parties.  I can send 1 oz of gold to the moon by exchanging it for crypto here, send the crypto to a moon wallet, and have the recipient exchange it back into gold.  So it's a medium of exchange.
